sequence.notes: Cascade reaction involving imine formation, intramolecular cyclization (Pictet-Spengler type), lactam formation, and oxazolidine ring formation. The chiral center from the amino alcohol is retained, and a new chiral center is formed from the aldehyde.

sequence.reaction_type: Grignard reaction / Cyclic N,O-acetal ring opening
sequence.notes: A Grignard reagent reacts with the cyclic N,O-acetal of the reactant, leading to the opening of the five-membered ring. The Grignard carbon chain (propyl-1,3-dioxane) adds to the carbon atom that was part of the original oxazolidine ring and fused to the benzene system. Concurrently, the nitrogen atom is alkylated with the phenyl-substituted ethanol fragment.

Reductive cyclization involving deprotection of an acetal to an aldehyde, followed by reductive amination with the secondary amine to form a pyrrolidine ring. Simultaneously, the N-benzyl-like group (PhCH(CH2OH)-) is removed via hydrogenolysis.
